sen.j: 足利 義政（あしかが よしまさ）は、室町幕府の第8代征夷大将軍（在位：宝徳元年（1449年）－文明 (日本)5年（1473年））。
sen.e: Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA was the 8th Seii Taishogun of the Muromachi Shogunate (reigned between 1449 - 1473).
sen.cmt: 室町幕府 = Muromachi Shogunate; 征夷大将軍 = Seii Taishogun/Barbarian Subduing Generalissimo, いずれも英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA was the 8th Seii Taishogun of the Muromachi Shogunate (reigned between 1449 - 1473).
Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA was the 8th Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Muromachi Shogunate (reigned between 1449 - 1473).
sen.cmt: Seii Taishogun→Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians")に変更しました。

sen.j: 父は第6代将軍の足利義教。
sen.e: His father was the 6th Shogun, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.
His father was the 6th Shogun, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.
His father was the 6th Shogun, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 母は日野重光の娘で義教の側室である日野重子。
sen.e: His mother was Yoshinori's concubine, Shigeko HINO, who was a daughter of Shigemitsu HINO.
His mother was Yoshinori's concubine, Shigeko HINO, who was a daughter of Shigemitsu HINO.
His mother was Yoshinori's concubine, Shigeko HINO, who was a daughter of Shigemitsu HINO.

sen.j: 乳母で側室に今参局。
sen.e: Imamairi no Tsubone was his wet nurse as well as his concubine.
Imamairi no Tsubone was his wet nurse as well as his concubine.
Imamairi no Tsubone was his wet nurse as well as his concubine.

sen.j: 正室に日野富子。
sen.e: His official wife was Tomiko HINO.
His official wife was Tomiko HINO.
His official wife was Tomiko HINO.

sen.j: 同母弟に足利義視、同母兄に足利義勝。
sen.e: Yoshimi ASHIKAGA was his younger brother by the same mother, and Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA was his older brother by the same mother.
Yoshimi ASHIKAGA was his younger brother by the same mother, and Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA was his older brother by the same mother.
Yoshimi ASHIKAGA was his younger brother by the same mother, and Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA was his older brother by the same mother.

sen.j: 異母弟に足利政知。
sen.e: Masatomo ASHIKAGA was his younger brother by a different mother.
Masatomo ASHIKAGA was his younger brother by a different mother.
Masatomo ASHIKAGA was his younger brother by a different mother.

sen.j: 室町幕府の全盛期を築いた第3代将軍・足利義満の孫にあたる。
sen.e: He was a grandson of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the 3rd Shogun who built the most prosperous era during the Muromachi Shogunate.
He was a grandson of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the 3rd Shogun who built the most prosperous era during the Muromachi Shogunate.
He was a grandson of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the 3rd Shogun who built the most prosperous era during the Muromachi Shogunate.

sen.j: 幕府の財政難と土一揆に苦しみ政治を疎んだ。
sen.e: Because he suffered from peasant uprisings and financial distress he grew weary of political administration.
sen.cmt: 土一揆 = peasant uprising, 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Because he suffered from peasant uprisings and financial distress he grew weary of political administration.
Because he suffered from peasant uprisings and financial distress he grew weary of political administration.

sen.j: 幕政を富子や細川勝元・山名宗全らの有力守護大名に委ねて、自らはもっぱら数奇の道を探求した文化人であった。
sen.e: He left his administrative duties of the Shogunate to Tomiko and other influential Shugo-daimyo members, such as Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and Sozen YAMANA, and he became a man of culture who pondered his unhappy way of life.

He left his administrative duties of the Shogunate to Tomiko and other influential Shugo-daimyo members, such as Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and Sozen YAMANA, and he became a man of culture who pondered his unhappy way of life.

He left his administrative duties of the Shogunate to Tomiko and other influential Shugo-daimyo members, such as Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and Sozen YAMANA, and he became a man of culture who pondered his unhappy way of life.

sen.j: 永享8年（1436年）1月2日、第6代将軍・足利義教の子として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born on January 2nd, 1436, as a son of the 6th Shogun, Yoshinori ASHKAGA.
He was born on January 2nd, 1436, as a son of the 6th Shogun, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.
He was born on January 2, 1436, as a son of the 6th Shogun, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 嘉吉元年（1441年）、父の義教が嘉吉の乱で赤松満祐に殺された後、将軍職は同母兄の足利義勝が継いだ。
sen.e: After his father, Yoshinori, was killed by Mitsusuke AKAMATSU in the Kakitsu War, his older brother by the same mother, Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA, was installed as the Shogun. However, because the 7th Shogun, Yoshikatsu ASHKAGA, died young in 1447, Yoshimasa was chosen as the Shogun at the age of 8 under the guardianship of kanrei Mochikuni HATAKEYAMA. When he became of age in 1449 he officially assumed his position as the 8th Shogun.
sen.cmt: 嘉吉の乱 = the Kakitsu War, http://www.shejapan.com/whs/himeji/himeji.html; Translated text divided into 3 sentences.一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1441, after his father, Yoshinori, was killed by Mitsusuke AKAMATSU in the Kakitsu War, his older brother by the same mother, Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA, was installed as the Shogun.
sen.cmt: 英訳が3文に分けられていた為、セル23, 24を作り英文を分割。原文も訂正。In 1441, を補足。
sen.e: In 1441, after his father, Yoshinori, was killed by Mitsusuke AKAMATSU in the Kakitsu War, his older brother by the same mother, Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA, was installed as the Shogun.

sen.j: 嘉吉3年（1443年）に第7代将軍の足利義勝も早世したため、義政は管領の畠山持国などの後見を得て、8歳で将軍職に選出された。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because the 7th Shogun, Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA, died young in 1443, Yoshimasa was chosen as the Shogun at the age of 8 under the guardianship of kanrei Mochikuni HATAKEYAMA.
However, because the 7th Shogun, Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA, died young in 1443, Yoshimasa was chosen as the Shogun at the age of 8 under the guardianship of kanrei Mochikuni HATAKEYAMA.

sen.j: 元服を迎えた宝徳元年（1449年）に正式に第8代将軍として就任した。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When he had a coming of age ceremony in 1449 he officially assumed his position as the 8th Shogun.
sen.cmt: 元服→a coming of age ceremony
sen.e: When he had a coming of age ceremony in 1449 he officially assumed his position as the 8th Shogun.

tit.e: Transition to Political Administration by His Aides
Transition to Political Administration by His Aides
Transition to Political Administration by His Aides

sen.j: 当初の義政は祖父・義満や父・義教の政策を復活させようと試み、また鎌倉公方（後に古河公方）足利成氏と関東管領上杉氏との大規模な内紛（享徳の乱）に対しては成氏追討令を発して異母弟の堀越公方・足利政知を派遣するなどして積極的な介入をした。
sen.e: At the beginning, Yoshimasa tried to revive the political agenda of his grandfather, Yoshimitsu, and his father, Yoshinori, and he actively intervened in the large-scale infighting between Kamakura-kubo (Koga-kubo) and Kanto-kanrei Uesugi clan by ordering Horigoe-kubo Masatomo ASHKAGA, his younger brother by a different mother, to subjugate Shigeuji. However, he virtually had no political power as a Shogun because his wet nurse, Imamairi no Tsubone, Suketo KARASUMA and Mochiie ARIMA, collectively known and the three devils, as well as Sadachika ISE, the steward of Shogun's family, and the family of his official wife, Tomiko HINO, began their political interventions.
sen.cmt: 上杉氏 = Uesugi clan, 英辞郎 on the WEB; 享徳の乱 = the Kyotoku War, http://www.fides.dti.ne.jp/~shinn/event_nip.html; Translated text divided into 2 sentences.一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the beginning, Yoshimasa tried to revive the political agenda of his grandfather, Yoshimitsu, and his father, Yoshinori, and he actively intervened in the large-scale infighting (the Kyotoku War) between Kamakura-kubo (later Koga-kubo) Shigeuji ASHIKAGA and Kanto-kanrei Uesugi clan by ordering Horigoe-kubo Masatomo ASHIKAGA, his younger brother by a different mother, to subjugate Shigeuji.
sen.cmt: 英訳が2文に分けられていた為、セル29を作り英文を分割。原文も訂正。(the Kyotoku War)を補足。Koga-kubo→later Koga-kuboShigeuji ASHIKAGAを補足。Masatomo ASHKAGA→Masatomo ASHIKAGA
sen.e: At the beginning, Yoshimasa tried to revive the political agenda of his grandfather, Yoshimitsu, and his father, Yoshinori, and he actively intervened in the large-scale infighting (the Kyotoku War) between Kamakura-kubo (later Koga-kubo) Shigeuji ASHIKAGA and Kanto-kanrei Uesugi clan by ordering Horigoe-kubo Masatomo ASHIKAGA, his younger brother by a different mother, to subjugate Shigeuji.

sen.j: 三魔と呼ばれる乳母の今参局・烏丸資任・有馬持家をはじめ、将軍家の執事であった伊勢貞親や正室・日野富子の実家の日野氏等の側近が政治に介入していき、将軍としての政治の実権は無いに等しい立場であった。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he virtually had no political power as a Shogun because his wet nurse, Imamairi no Tsubone, Suketo KARASUMA and Mochiie ARIMA, collectively known and the three devils, as well as Sadachika ISE, the steward of Shogun's family, and aides like the family of his official wife, Tomiko HINO, began their political interventions.

However, he virtually had no political power as a Shogun because his wet nurse, Imamairi no Tsubone, Suketo KARASUMA and Mochiie ARIMA, collectively known as the three devils, as well as Sadachika ISE, the steward of Shogun's family, and aides like the family of his official wife, Tomiko HINO, began their political interventions.

sen.j: それを思い知らせる事件が何度か起きている。
sen.e: Several events took place to validate that fact.
Several events took place to validate that fact.
Several events took place to validate that fact.

sen.j: 当時の守護大名では家督相続に関する内紛が多かった。
sen.e: At the time, internal disputes often took place among the Shugo-daimyo regarding the successor to the head of the family. Yoshimasa, at first, actively intervened into these family heir disputes, but he met opposition from kanrei Katsumoto HOSOKAWA regarding the internal dispute of the Togashi clan of the Province of Kaga, and Yoshimasa could not influence the issue of family heir the way he wanted.
sen.cmt: Translated text divided into 2 sentences.一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the time, internal disputes often took place among the Shugo-daimyo regarding the successor to the head of the family.
sen.cmt: 英訳が2文に分けられていた為、セル33を作り英文を分割。原文も訂正。
sen.e: At the time, internal disputes often took place among the Shugo-daimyo regarding the successor to the head of the family.

sen.j: 義政ははじめこれらの相続争いに積極的に介入したが、加賀国守護であった富樫氏の内紛では管領・細川勝元の反対を受けて義政の意のままに相続権を動かすことができなかった。
sen.cmt: 加賀国 = the Province of Kaga, プログレッシブ英和中辞典; 富樫氏 = Togashi clan, 英辞郎 on the WEB; 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshimasa, at first, actively intervened into these family heir disputes, but he met opposition from kanrei Katsumoto HOSOKAWA regarding the internal dispute of the Togashi clan, the shugo of the Province of Kaga, and Yoshimasa could not influence the issue of family heir the way he wanted.

Yoshimasa, at first, actively intervened into these family heir disputes, but he met opposition from kanrei Katsumoto HOSOKAWA regarding the internal dispute of the Togashi clan, the shugo of the Province of Kaga, and Yoshimasa could not influence the issue of family heir the way he wanted.

sen.j: 宝徳3年（1451年）にも尾張国守護代であった織田氏の内紛に介入したが、尾張守護である斯波氏の反対を受けて義政の意のままに動かすことはできなかった。
sen.e: Also, in 1451, he intervened in the internal dispute in the Oda clan who was the Shugodai of the Province of Owari, but again, he met opposition from the Owari Shugo Shiba clan and he was not able to exercise his influence the way he wanted.
sen.cmt: 尾張国 = the Province of Owari, プログレッシブ英和中辞典; 斯波氏 = Shiba clan = 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Also, in 1451, he intervened in the internal dispute in the Oda clan who was the Shugodai of the Province of Owari, but again, he met opposition from the Owari Shugo Shiba clan and he was not able to exercise his influence the way he wanted.

Also, in 1451, he intervened in the internal dispute in the Oda clan who was the Shugodai of the Province of Owari, but again, he met opposition from the Owari Shugo Shiba clan and he was not able to exercise his influence the way he wanted.

sen.j: このように政は義政の意に沿って進まない事が多く、次第に義政は政治への関心を失っていった。
sen.e: Therefore, since politics did not go according to Yoshimasa's plans he gradually lost interest in politics.
Therefore, since politics did not go according to Yoshimasa's plans he gradually lost interest in politics.
Therefore, since politics did not go according to Yoshimasa's plans he gradually lost interest in politics.

tit.j: 後継者問題から応仁の乱へ
tit.e: From the Issue of the Heir to the Onin war
From the Issue of the Heir to the Onin war
From the Issue of the Heir to the Onin war

sen.j: 義政には正室の日野富子との間に男子があったが、長禄3年（1459年）に早世してしまった。
sen.e: There was a son between Yoshimasa and his official wife, Tomiko HINO, but he died young in 1459.
There was a son between Yoshimasa and his official wife, Tomiko HINO, but he died young in 1459.
There was a son between Yoshimasa and his official wife, Tomiko HINO, but he died young in 1459.

sen.j: すると富子は実子の早世は今参局が呪詛したものであるとして、彼女を琵琶湖の沖ノ島に流罪に処した。
sen.e: Tomiko, then accused Imamairi no Tsubone for killing her son by putting a curse on him, and she banished her to Okinoshima Island on Lake Biwa.
sen.cmt: 琵琶湖 = Lake Biwa, 英辞郎 on the WEB; 沖ノ島 = Okinoshima island, http://www.allaboutgemstones.com/pearl-farms_japan.html
sen.e: Tomiko, then accused Imamairi no Tsubone for killing her son by putting a curse on him, and she banished her to Okinoshima Island on Lake Biwa.
Tomiko, then accused Imamairi no Tsubone for killing her son by putting a curse on him, and she banished her to Okinoshima Island on Lake Biwa.

sen.j: このため、以後は富子や伊勢貞親ら将軍側近の権勢が強まるようになる。
sen.e: Because of this, from this point on, the power of Tomiko and Shogun's aides, including Sadachika ISE, strengthened.
Because of this, from this point on, the power of Tomiko and Shogun's aides, including Sadachika ISE, strengthened.
Because of this, from this point on, the power of Tomiko and Shogun's aides, including Sadachika ISE, strengthened.

sen.j: また、飢饉や災害が相次いだ。
sen.e: Furthermore, famine and disasters occurred one after another. In particular, the Kansho Famine in 1461 left a tremendous disaster in Kyoto, and according to one account the flow of Kamo-gawa River stopped because of the corpses of the people who died from starvation.
sen.cmt: Translated text divided into 2 sentences.一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, famine and disasters occurred one after another.
sen.cmt: 英訳が2文に分けられていた為、セル44を作り英文を分割。原文も訂正。
sen.e: Furthermore, famine and disasters occurred one after another.

sen.j: 特に寛正2年（1461年）の寛正の大飢饉は京都にも大被害をもたらし、一説では賀茂川の流れが餓死者の死骸のために止まるほどであったとされる。
sen.cmt: 寛正の大飢饉 = Kansho famine, http://www.armageddononline.org/List-of-Famines.html; 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In particular, the Kansho Famine in 1461 left a tremendous disaster in Kyoto, and according to one account the flow of Kamo-gawa River stopped because of the corpses of the people who died from starvation.

In particular, the Kansho Famine in 1461 left a tremendous disaster in Kyoto, and according to one account the flow of Kamo-gawa River stopped because of the corpses of the people who died from starvation.

sen.j: このような内外の状況で完全に政治への意欲を失った義政は、邸宅造営などの土木事業や猿楽、酒宴に溺れていく。
sen.e: Because of these internal and external situations Yoshimasa completely lost his motivation in politics, and he gradually immersed himself in construction projects, such as building mansions, sarugaku and holding drinking parties.
sen.cmt: 猿楽 = sarugakusarugaku = established translation not confirmed, precursor to noh plays, left as sarugaku; possible suggestions include noh plays, satirical comedies and plays
sen.e: Because of these internal and external situations Yoshimasa completely lost his motivation in politics, and he gradually immersed himself in construction projects, such as building mansions, sarugaku and holding drinking parties.

Because of these internal and external situations Yoshimasa completely lost his motivation in politics, and he gradually immersed himself in construction projects, such as building mansions, sarugaku and holding drinking parties.

sen.j: 殊に寛正の飢饉間にそれを意に介さずに花の御所を改築、後花園天皇の勧告さえも無視したことは悪名高い。
sen.e: In particular, even during the Kansho Famine he paid no attention, and he reconstructed Hana no Gosho, and he is infamous for ignoring even Emperor Go-Hanazono's admonishment regarding this matter.
sen.cmt: 後花園天皇 = the Emperor Go-Hanazono, 英辞郎 on the WEB; 花の御所 = Hana no Gosho
sen.e: In particular, even during the Kansho Famine he paid no attention, and he reconstructed Hana no Gosho, and he is infamous for ignoring even Emperor Go-Hanazono's admonishment regarding this matter.

In particular, even during the Kansho Famine he paid no attention to political matters, focusing instead on the reconstruction of Hana no Gosho; he is infamous for ignoring even Emperor Go-Hanazono's admonishment regarding this matter.
sen.cmt: pay attention to の目的語を明確にする。

sen.j: そして寛正5年（1464年）には隠居を考えるようになった。
sen.e: In 1464, he began to think about retiring.
In 1464, he began to think about retiring.
In 1464, he began to think about retiring.

sen.j: しかし、富子との間に嫡子が恵まれなかったため、実弟の義尋を還俗させて足利義視と名乗らせ、養子として次期将軍に決定した。
sen.e: However, because he and Tomiko were not blessed with an heir, he brought his younger brother, Gijin, back to the secular life, named him Yoshimi ASHIKAGA, and as his adopted son, he assigned him to be the next Shogun.

However, because he and Tomiko were not blessed with an heir, he brought his younger brother, Gijin, back to the secular life, named him Yoshimi ASHIKAGA, and as his adopted son, he assigned him to be the next Shogun.

However, because he and Tomiko were not blessed with an heir, he brought his younger brother, Gijin, back to the secular life, named him Yoshimi ASHIKAGA, and as his adopted son, he assigned him to be the next Shogun.

sen.j: ところが、寛正6年（1465年）に富子に実子（後の足利義尚）が誕生すると、富子は義尚への将軍後継を望み、政権の実力者であった山名持豊（宗全）に協力を頼んだ。
sen.e: However, after Tomiko gave birth to a child (later Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA) in 1465 she expressed her desire for Yoshihisa to be the heir to the Shogun, so she asked Mochitoyo (Sozen) YAMANA for his support, because he had the true political clout. On the other hand, Yoshimi allied with kanrei Katsumoto HOSOKAWA.
sen.cmt: Translated text divided into 2 sentences.一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, after Tomiko gave birth to a child (later Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA) in 1465 she expressed her desire for Yoshihisa to be the heir to the Shogun, so she asked Mochitoyo (Sozen) YAMANA for his support, because he had the true political clout.
sen.cmt: 英訳が2文に分けられていた為、セル52を作り英文を分割。原文も訂正。
sen.e: However, after Tomiko gave birth to a child (later Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA) in 1465 she expressed her desire for Yoshihisa to be the heir to the Shogun, so she asked Mochitoyo (Sozen) YAMANA for his support, because he had the true political clout.

sen.j: 一方の義視は管領の細川勝元と手を結んだ。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, Yoshimi allied with kanrei Katsumoto HOSOKAWA.
On the other hand, Yoshimi allied with kanrei Katsumoto HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: このため、足利将軍家の家督継承問題が起るが、当の義政はどちらにも将軍職を譲らず、文化的な趣味に興じるなど優柔不断な態度を続けた。
sen.e: Consequently, the issue of ASHIKAGA shogun family's heir arose, but Yoshimasa was not willing to relinquish his position as the Shogun to either party, and he continued to show an irresolute behavior by immersing himself in his cultural interests.

Consequently, the issue of ASHIKAGA shogun family's heir arose, but Yoshimasa was not willing to relinquish his position as the Shogun to either party, and he continued to show an irresolute behavior by immersing himself in his cultural interests.
sen.cmt: positionの前のスペースを調整。
sen.e: Consequently, the issue of ASHIKAGA shogun family's heir arose, but Yoshimasa was not willing to relinquish his position as the Shogun to either party, and he continued to show an irresolute behavior by immersing himself in his cultural interests.

sen.j: その上、先に起こった斯波氏や畠山氏の家督相続問題も関与して、応仁元年（1467年）、遂に応仁の乱が発生する。
sen.e: In addition, the issues on the heirs in the Shiba clan and Hatakeyama clan arose, and the Onin war finally erupted in 1467.
sen.cmt: 応仁の乱 = the Onin war, 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: In addition, the issues on the heirs in the Shiba clan and Hatakeyama clan that had arisen before was related to this issue, and the Onin war finally erupted in 1467.
sen.cmt: 先に起こった、とあるのでthat had arisen beforeを補足。was related to this issueを補足。
sen.e: In addition, the issues on the heirs in the Shiba clan and Hatakeyama clan that had arisen before was related to this issue, and the Onin war finally erupted in 1467.

sen.j: 戦乱は吉野朝廷の末裔（後南朝）まで参加するなど、収拾がつかない全国規模なものへ発展していった。
sen.e: Even the descendants of Yoshino (Imperial) Court (Go-nancho) entered the war, and it escalated into an out-of-control war that involved the entire nation.
sen.cmt: 吉野朝廷 = Yoshino (Imperial) Court, 英辞郎 on the WEB、およびhttp://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/fl20030706a1.html
sen.e: Even the descendants of Yoshino (Imperial) Court (Go-nancho) entered the war, and it escalated into an out-of-control war that involved the entire nation.
Even the descendants of Yoshino (Imperial) Court (Go-nancho) entered the war, and it escalated into an out-of-control war that involved the entire nation.

sen.j: しかし義政は戦乱に対処することも無く酒宴や連歌の会を行なうのに終始し、さらに花の御所（京都市上京区）から小川邸へ移り、将軍後継者問題で不和になった富子とも別居を始めた。
sen.e: However, Yoshimasa did not even bother to deal with the war and he spent all of his time holding drinking and renga poetry parties, and furthermore, he moved to Ogawa mansion and he started to live separately from Tomiko, with whom he was no longer getting along because of the issue of Shogun's heir.

However, Yoshimasa did not even bother to deal with the war and he spent all of his time holding drinking and renga poetry parties, and furthermore, he moved to Ogawa mansion from Hana no Gosho (Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City) and he started to live separately from Tomiko, with whom he was no longer getting along because of the issue of Shogun's heir.
sen.cmt: from Hana no Gosho, (Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City)を補足。
sen.e: However, Yoshimasa did not even bother to deal with the war and he spent all of his time holding drinking and renga poetry parties, and furthermore, he moved to Ogawa mansion from Hana no Gosho (Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City) and he started to live separately from Tomiko, with whom he was no longer getting along because of the issue of Shogun's heir.

sen.j: 文明5年（1473年）に西軍の山名持豊（宗全）、東軍の細川勝元の両名が死んだことを契機に、義政は12月に将軍職を子の足利義尚へ譲って正式に隠居した。
sen.e: In 1473, when the West Army's Mochitoyo (Sozen) YAMANA and the East Army's Katsumoto HOSOKAWA both died Yoshimasa took this opportunity to hand over his position as the Shogun to his son, Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA, in December, and he officially retired.

In 1473, when the West Army's Mochitoyo (Sozen) YAMANA and the East Army's Katsumoto HOSOKAWA both died Yoshimasa took this opportunity to hand over his position as the Shogun to his son, Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA, in December, and he officially retired.

In 1473, when the West Army's Mochitoyo (Sozen) YAMANA and the East Army's Katsumoto HOSOKAWA both died Yoshimasa took this opportunity to hand over his position as the Shogun to his son, Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA, in December, and he officially retired.

sen.j: 富子との不和は相変わらずで、文明7年（1475年）に花の御所が京都市街の戦火で焼失し、富子と息子・足利義尚が小川邸へ移ると、義政は逃げるように東山へ移っている。
sen.e: The discord between him and Tomiko remained unchanged, and when Hana no Gosho burned down due to a war in the city of Kyoto in 1475 Tomiko and Yoshihisa moved to Ogawa mansion, but he relocated to Higashiyama as if he was running away from them.
sen.cmt: 花の御所 = Hana no Gosho
sen.e: The discord between him and Tomiko remained unchanged, and when Hana no Gosho burned down due to a war in the city of Kyoto in 1475 Tomiko and Yoshihisa moved to Ogawa mansion, but he relocated to Higashiyama as if he was running away from them.

The discord between Yoshimasa and Tomiko remained unchanged, and when Hana no Gosho burned down due to a war in the city of Kyoto in 1475, Tomiko and Yoshihisa moved to Ogawa mansion while Yoshimasa relocated to Higashiyama as if he was running away from them.

sen.j: 文明9年（1477年）に応仁の乱は終わるが、義尚とはこの頃から意見の食い違いが起こり、富子ともさらに仲が悪くなっていく。
sen.e: Onin war ended in 1477, however, he and Yoshihsa had differences in their opinions and his relationship with Tomiko worsened even more.
Onin war ended in 1477, however, he and Yoshihisa had differences in their opinions and his relationship with Tomiko worsened even more.
Onin war ended in 1477, however, he and Yoshihisa had differences in their opinions and his relationship with Tomiko worsened even more.

sen.j: 現に当時、室町殿（義尚）に対し、東山殿（義政）と呼ばれ、政治の決定機関がふたつに分裂していたようである。
sen.e: In reality, back then, there was Higashiyama-dono (Yoshimasa) as opposed to Muromachi-dono (Yoshihisa), and the policymaking government seemed to have been split into two bodies.
In reality, back then, there was Higashiyama-dono (Yoshimasa) as opposed to Muromachi-dono (Yoshihisa), and the policymaking government seemed to have been split into two bodies.
In reality, back then, there was Higashiyama-dono (Yoshimasa) as opposed to Muromachi-dono (Yoshihisa), and the policymaking government seemed to have been split into two bodies.

sen.j: そのためか、応仁の乱後に義政は隠匿し、その後はさらに文化的な活動に拍車がかかった。
sen.e: Perhaps, because of this reason, Yoshimasa went into hiding after the Onin war and he became even more active in his cultural activities after that.
Perhaps, because of this reason, Yoshimasa went into hiding after the Onin war and he became even more active in his cultural activities after that.
Perhaps, because of this reason, Yoshimasa went into hiding after the Onin war and he became even more active in his cultural activities after that.

sen.j: 文明14年（1482年）には東山山荘（東山殿）の造営をはじめ、祖父・足利義満が建てた鹿苑寺をベースにした慈照寺などを建てた。
sen.e: In 1482, he built Higashiyama sanso (Higashiyama-dono), and he built Jisho-ji Temple based on the Rokuon-ji Temple that was built by his grandfather, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.
In 1482, he built Higashiyama sanso villa (Higashiyama-dono), and he built Jisho-ji Temple based on the Rokuon-ji Temple that was built by his grandfather, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.
In 1482, he built Higashiyama sanso villa (Higashiyama-dono), and he built Jisho-ji Temple based on the Rokuon-ji Temple that was built by his grandfather, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 文明17年（1485年）5月には、義尚の側近と義政の側近が武力衝突する事件が起こっているなど、義政と義尚の対立は激化する。
sen.e: Yoshimasa and Yoshihisa's rivalry intensified, as evidenced by the armed encounter between Yoshihisa's aides and those close to Yoshimasa in May, 1485.
Yoshimasa and Yoshihisa's rivalry intensified, as evidenced by the armed encounter between Yoshihisa's aides and those close to Yoshimasa in May, 1485.
Yoshimasa and Yoshihisa's rivalry intensified, as evidenced by the armed encounter between Yoshihisa's aides and those close to Yoshimasa in May, 1485.

sen.j: このため6月、義政は剃髪して出家し、事実上政務から離れることを決めた。
sen.e: Because of this reason, in June, Yoshimasa shaved his head and became an ordained monk, and he decided to leave from his effective duties in the government.
Because of this reason, in June, Yoshimasa shaved his head and became an ordained monk, and he decided to leave from his effective duties in the government.
Because of this reason, in June, Yoshimasa shaved his head and became an ordained monk, and he decided to leave from his effective duties in the government.

sen.j: 子の義尚が延徳元年（1489年）に六角討伐の陣中で死去したため、やむなく政務の場に復帰することを決意するが、正室の日野富子が義政の復帰に反対した。
sen.e: He decided unwillingly to return to his administrative duties in 1489 when his son, Yoshihisa, died in the battle during the subjugation of Rokkaku, but his official wife, Tomiko HINO, opposed to his return. Furthermore, Yoshimasa was stricken with paralysis, which made it difficult for him to assume administrative duties, so he made peace with his brother, Yoshimi, who had defected to the Province of Mino, and adopted Yoshimi's eldest son, Yoshiki (Yoshitane) ASHIKAGA, and assigned him as the 10th Shogun and entrusted him with the governmental affairs after his passing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He decided unwillingly to return to his administrative duties in 1489 when his son, Yoshihisa, died in the battle during the subjugation of Rokkaku, but his official wife, Tomiko HINO, opposed to his return.
sen.cmt: 英訳が2文に分けられていた為、セル74を作り英文を分割。原文も訂正。
sen.e: He decided unwillingly to return to his administrative duties in 1489 when his son, Yoshihisa, died in the battle during the subjugation of Rokkaku, but his official wife, Tomiko HINO, opposed to his return.

sen.j: さらに義政自身も中風に倒れて政務を執ることが困難となったため、美濃に亡命していた弟の義視と和睦し、義視の嫡男・足利義材（義稙）を自らの養子に迎えることで第10代将軍に指名して後事を託した。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, Yoshimasa was stricken with paralysis, which made it difficult for him to assume administrative duties, so he made peace with his brother, Yoshimi, who had defected to the Province of Mino, and adopted Yoshimi's eldest son, Yoshiki (Yoshitane) ASHIKAGA, and assigned him as the 10th Shogun and entrusted him with the governmental affairs after his passing.

Furthermore, Yoshimasa was stricken with paralysis, which made it difficult for him to assume administrative duties, so he made peace with his brother, Yoshimi, who had defected to the Province of Mino, and adopted Yoshimi's eldest son, Yoshiki (Yoshitane) ASHIKAGA, and assigned him as the 10th Shogun and entrusted him with the governmental affairs after his passing.

sen.j: 延徳2年（1490年）1月7日、銀閣の完成を待たずして死去。
sen.e: On January 7th, 1490, he passed away without seeing the completion of Ginkaku.
On January 7th, 1490, he passed away without seeing the completion of Ginkaku.
On January 7th, 1490, he passed away without seeing the completion of Ginkaku.

sen.j: 享年55。
sen.e: He was 55 years old.
He was 55 years old.
He was 55 years old.

sen.j: 法名：慈照院喜山道慶。
sen.e: Posthumous name : Jishoin Kizan Dokei
Posthumous name : Jishoin Kizan Dokei
Posthumous name : Jishoin Kizan Dokei

sen.j: 墓所は京都市上京区の相国寺ほか。
sen.e: His grave is located in Shokoku-ji Temple in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, among others.
His grave is located in Shokoku-ji Temple in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, among others.
His grave is located in Shokoku-ji Temple in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, among others.

tit.cmt: Personal Character→Personal Profileに変更しました。

sen.j: 文化面では功績を残している。
sen.e: On the cultural side, he has left distinguished works.
On the cultural side, he has left distinguished works.
On the cultural side, he has left distinguished works.

sen.j: 庭師の善阿弥や狩野派の絵師狩野正信、能楽者の音阿弥らを召抱え、東山の地に東山殿を築いた（のちに慈照寺となり、銀閣、東求堂が現在に残る）。
sen.e: He employed landscape artist, Zen'ami, painter of KANO party, Masanobu KANO, and noh artist, On'ami, among others, and he constructed Higashiyama-dono on the grounds of Higashiyama (it later became Jisho-ji Temple, and Ginkaku and Togu-do still remain to this day).

He employed landscape artist, Zen'ami, painter of KANO party, Masanobu KANO, and noh artist, On'ami, among others, and he constructed Higashiyama-dono villa on the grounds of Higashiyama (it later became Jisho-ji Temple, and Ginkaku and Togu-do Hall still remain to this day).

He employed landscape artist, Zenami, painter of KANO party, Masanobu KANO, and noh artist, Onami, among others, and he constructed Higashiyama-dono villa on the grounds of Higashiyama (it later became Jisho-ji Temple, and Ginkaku and Togu-do Hall still remain to this day).
sen.cmt: Zen'ami→Zenamiに変更しました。On'ami→Onamiに変更しました。

sen.j: この時代の文化を金閣に代表される3代義満時代の華やかな北山文化と対照的に、銀閣に代表されるわび・さびに重きをおいた「東山文化」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: In contrast to the lavish Kitayama culture represented by Kinkaku from the 3rd Shogun Yoshimitsu's era, the culture of this period is called "Higashiyama culture" that emphasizes simplicity and quietude as represented by Ginkaku.
sen.cmt: 北山文化 = Kitayama culture, 東山文化 = Higashiyama culture, いずれも出典：http://unpan1.un.org/intradoc/groups/public/documents/APCITY/UNPAN021949.htm; wabi and sabi = simplicity and quietude
sen.e: In contrast to the lavish Kitayama culture represented by Kinkaku from the 3rd Shogun Yoshimitsu's era, the culture of this period is called "Higashiyama culture" that emphasizes wabi-sabi (simplicity and quietude) as represented by Ginkaku.
sen.cmt: wabi-sabiは日本文化独特の用語なので補足。
sen.e: In contrast to the lavish Kitayama culture represented by Kinkaku from the 3rd Shogun Yoshimitsu's era, the culture of this period is called "Higashiyama culture" that emphasizes wabi-sabi (simplicity and quietude) as represented by Ginkaku.

sen.j: 政治的には、祖父の時代から絶大な影響力を保持していた日野家や側近の力を抑えきれず、幕府権力の衰退を助長したといえる。
sen.e: Politically, he was unable to suppress the immense influential powers of the Hino family and his aides, who had been powerful since the time of his grandfather, and therefore, it can be said that he aided the decline of the Shogunate's power.

Politically, he was unable to suppress the immense influential powers of the Hino family and his aides, who had been powerful since the time of his grandfather, and therefore, it can be said that he aided the decline of the Shogunate's power.

Politically, he was unable to suppress the immense influential powers of the Hino family and his aides, who had been powerful since the time of his grandfather, and therefore, it can be said that he aided the decline of the Shogunate's power.

sen.j: 義教の死後中断していた勘合貿易を宝徳3年（1451年）に復活させ、これは以後16世紀半ばまで続いた。
sen.e: After Yoshinori's death, in 1451, he restored the tally trade (between Japan and the Ming dynasty) that had been discontinued, and it continued until mid-16th century.
sen.cmt: 勘合貿易 = the tally trade (between Japan and the Ming dynasty), http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110006000558/
sen.e: After Yoshinori's death, in 1451, he restored the tally trade (between Japan and the Ming dynasty) that had been discontinued, and it continued until mid-16th century.
After Yoshinori's death, in 1451, he restored the tally trade (between Japan and the Ming dynasty) that had been discontinued, and it continued until mid-16th century.

sen.j: 貿易による経済交流と文化発展に寄与することとなった。
sen.e: He contributed to the cultural development and financial exchange through trade.
He contributed to the cultural development and financial exchange through trade.
He contributed to the cultural development and financial exchange through trade.

sen.j: 皮肉にも勘合貿易の復活や義政から実権を奪った守護大名や側近の幕府官僚の財政再建策が功を奏して、義政の治世前半は義満の時代と並んで幕府財政は安定期であったとされている。
sen.e: Ironically, the revival of tally trade successfully rebuilt the financial circumstances of Shogunate's kanrei, who were his aides, and Shugo daimyo who robbed the administrative power from Yoshimasa, and therefore the Shogunate's financial situation was very stable during the first half of Yoshimasa's rule, just as it had been during Yoshimitsu's era.

Ironically, the revival of tally trade and the rebuilding plan of financial circumstances by the Shogunate's officials, who were his aides, and Shugo daimyo who robbed the administrative power from Yoshimasa, were successful and therefore the Shogunate's financial situation was very stable during the first half of Yoshimasa's rule, just as it had been during Yoshimitsu's era.
sen.cmt: 原文の、(勘合貿易の)復活と財政再建策は共に功を奏して、に掛かる。英訳前半を訂正。
sen.e: Ironically, the revival of tally trade and the rebuilding plan of financial circumstances by the Shogunate's officials, who were his aides, and Shugo daimyo who robbed the administrative power from Yoshimasa, were successful and therefore the Shogunate's financial situation was very stable during the first half of Yoshimasa's rule, just as it had been during Yoshimitsu's era.

sen.j: だが、義政はその成果を幕府の権威回復や民衆の救済にではなく、趣味の建築や庭園に費やしてしまい、応仁の乱後の財政難の原因を作ってしまった。
sen.e: However, instead of using his accomplishment for restoring Shogunate's power or aiding his people Yoshimasa spent it on his hobbies such as architecture and landscaping, and he created the cause of the financial difficulties after the Onin war.

However, instead of using his accomplishment for restoring Shogunate's power or aiding his people Yoshimasa spent it on his hobbies such as architecture and landscaping, and he created the cause of the financial difficulties after the Onin war.

However, instead of using his accomplishments to restore the Shogunate's power or aid his people, Yoshimasa spent it on his hobbies such as architecture and landscaping, creating the cause of the financial difficulties experienced after the Onin war.
sen.cmt: instead of ～peopleの後にコンマを補い、全体的に修正。

tit.e: Chronology of Government Posts and Ranks
Chronology of Government Posts and Ranks
Chronology of Government Posts and Ranks

sen.e: Lunar calendar used for the dates.

sen.j: 1446年（文安3年）10月15日、従五位上に叙す。
sen.e: October 15, 1446, given the rank of Jugoi-jo
October 15, 1446, given the rank of Jugoi-jo.

sen.j: 1447年（文安4年）2月7日、正五位下に昇叙し、侍従に任官。
sen.e: February 7, 1447, promoted to Shogoi-ge and assumed the position of Jiju.
sen.cmt: 侍従 = Jiju, chamberlain or attendant, unconfirmed
sen.e: February 7, 1447, promoted to Shogoi-ge and assumed the position of Jiju.

sen.e: December, 26, 1448, transferred to the position of Sama-no-kami.
December, 26, 1448, transferred to the position of Sama-no-kami.
December 26, 1448: Transferred to the position of Sama-no-kami.

sen.e: April 16, 1449, became of age.
April 16, 1449, a coming-of-age ceremony.
April 16, 1449: A coming-of-age ceremony.

sen.j: 義成を名乗る。
sen.e: He was named Yoshinari.
He was named Yoshinari.
He was named Yoshinari.

sen.j: 4月29日、征夷大将軍宣下。
sen.e: April 29, named Seii Taishogun by the Emperor
April 29, named Seii Taishogun by the Emperor.

sen.j: 8月27日、従四位下に昇叙し、参議右に補任。
sen.e: August 27, promoted to Jushii-ge, assumed the position of Sangi-u
August 27, promoted to Jushii-ge, assumed the position of Sangi-u.

sen.j: 右近衛中将を兼任。
sen.e: Also assumed the position of Ukon'e-no-chujo.
Also assumed the position of Ukon'e-no-chujo.
Also assumed the position of Ukone-no-chujo.

sen.j: 1450年（宝徳2年）1月5日、従三位に昇叙。
sen.e: January, 5, 1450, promoted to Jusammi.
January, 5, 1450, promoted to Jusammi.

sen.e: March 29, transferred to the position to Gon-dainagon.
March 29, transferred to the position to Gon-dainagon.

sen.j: 6月27日、従二位に昇叙。
sen.e: June 27, promoted to Juni'i.

Gon-dainagon rank remained unchanged.

sen.j: 1473年（文明 (日本)5年）12月19日、征夷大将軍辞職。
